alert.note: Alert for Logan; Sherman; Thomas (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 30 at 11:51PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM CDT/3 AM MDT/ WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of northwest Kansas and west central Kansas, including the following counties, in northwest Kansas, Sherman and Thomas. In west central Kansas, Logan. * WHEN...Until 400 AM CDT /300 AM MDT/. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Expect many areas of slow moving or standing water. It will take several hours for all the water from these storms to work through local drainage systems in urban areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1150 PM CDT /1050 PM MDT/, the public reported an area of very heavy rainfall across the warned area. Between 1 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following streams and drainages... S Branch Hackberry Creek, N Branch Hackberry Creek, North Fork Saline River, Middle Branch Hackberry Creek, West Spring Creek, North Branch Hackberry Creek, Smoky Hill River, South Branch Hackberry Creek, Six Mile Gulch, Sand Creek, South Fork Saline River, Plum Creek and North Fork Smoky Hill River. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Winona and Monument. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
